summary: This document is a news clipping summary from the SDNY (Southern District of New York) dated January 10, 2020, covering multiple cases of public interest. It includes sections on Lev Parnas and the Trump impeachment, Michael Avenatti's extortion case, Jeffrey Epstein's donations to MIT, and updates on other legal cases involving Harvey Weinstein, Virgil Griffith, and others. The summary provides a snapshot of high-profile legal and political news relevant to the SDNY's jurisdiction at the time.

persons.name: Lev Parnas
persons.context: Subject of news clip regarding his potential testimony and evidence (iPhone contents) in Trump's Senate impeachment trial; accused of illegal campaign donations and involvement in efforts to find damaging information on Joe Biden in Ukraine.

persons.name: Joe Bondy
persons.context: Parnas's New York-based attorney who is sharing files with Congress and publicly advocating for Parnas to testify.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the impeachment trial and his connections to Lev Parnas and Rudy Giuliani.

persons.name: Rudy Giuliani
persons.context: Mentioned as having a close relationship with Parnas and being involved in the search for damaging information on Joe Biden in Ukraine.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Target of alleged efforts by Parnas and Giuliani to find damaging information in Ukraine.

persons.name: Marie Yovanovitch
persons.context: Mentioned as being ousted in a scheme allegedly involving Parnas and a Ukrainian official, which became a key moment in the impeachment investigation.

persons.name: Kevin McCarthy
persons.context: Photographed with Parnas; acknowledged receiving a donation from him but claimed not to know him.

persons.name: Mike Pence
persons.role: Vice President of the United States
persons.context: Photographed with Parnas and Kevin McCarthy.

persons.name: Michael Avenatti
persons.role: Celebrity lawyer facing federal extortion charges
persons.context: Subject of news clip regarding his case against Nike; accused of demanding millions from Nike to avoid a damaging press conference.

persons.name: Scott Srebnick
persons.context: Filed a court motion arguing that Nike executives mocked the FBI investigation.

persons.name: Paul Gardephe
persons.context: Weighing Avenatti's request to subpoena Nike executives.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of news clip regarding his $850,000 in donations to MIT and the subsequent investigation into the university's ties to him.

persons.name: Seth Lloyd
persons.context: Placed on paid leave for failing to inform MIT of multiple donations from Epstein.

persons.name: L. Rafael Reif
persons.context: Acknowledged signing a thank-you letter to Epstein in 2012; was cleared of wrongdoing in the investigative report.

persons.name: Joichi Ito
persons.role: Former director of the MIT Media Lab
persons.context: Acknowledged raising funds from Epstein; resigned amid scandal; involved in steps to conceal the lab's relationship with Epstein.

persons.name: Bill Gates
persons.context: Mentioned in an email where Ito claimed a $2 million gift was 'directed by Jeffrey Epstein'; Gates's representatives denied this.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Mentioned in an email exchange as someone Epstein was helping to connect to the MIT Media Lab; reportedly gave $4 million.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.role: Former film producer on trial for sex crimes
persons.context: Subject of news clip regarding the first week of his sex-crimes trial in New York, including jury selection issues.

persons.name: Arthur Aidala
persons.context: Filed a motion regarding jury selection, arguing potential jurors are biased and cannot speak freely due to media attention.

persons.name: James Burke
persons.context: Clashed with Weinstein's attorney in court over the jury selection motion.

persons.name: Joan Illuzzi
persons.context: Prosecutor in Weinstein's trial; objected to the defense's jury selection motion.

persons.name: Charlize Theron
persons.context: Named as a potential witness in Weinstein's trial.

persons.name: Salma Hayek
persons.context: Named as a potential witness in Weinstein's trial.

persons.name: Virgil Griffith
persons.context: Indicted for conspiracy to violate the International Emergency Economic Powers Act by providing services to North Korea.

persons.name: Brian Klein
persons.context: Stated Griffith should not have been indicted and plans to contest the charge vigorously.

persons.name: Sean Buckley
persons.context: Co-attorney for Griffith, mentioned in response to the indictment.

persons.name: John Demers
persons.role: Assistant Attorney General for National Security
persons.context: Commented on Griffith's arrest for traveling to North Korea to teach about blockchain technology.

persons.name: Kevin Jared Rosenberg
persons.context: Sought to erase more than $220,000 in student loans; case led to a significant bankruptcy court decision.

persons.name: Cecelia G. Morris
persons.role: Chief Bankruptcy Judge for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Authored a decision that may make it easier to discharge student loan debt in bankruptcy, criticizing the application of the 'Brunner test'.

persons.name: Peter Frank
persons.context: Commented on the potential impact of Judge Morris's decision on student loan bankruptcy filings.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.role: Public Affairs, U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Listed as the contact for the news clips document.

connections.description: Parnas had a close relationship with Giuliani, documented through photos and private Instagram posts, and assisted in Giuliani's search for damaging information on Joe Biden in Ukraine.
Photos show Parnas posing with Trump; Parnas's files and iPhone data may contain evidence of closer links than Trump has admitted.
Bondy is Parnas's attorney, representing him in his criminal case and facilitating the sharing of evidence with Congress.
Srebnick is Avenatti's lawyer, filing motions on his behalf in the Nike extortion case.
Ito acknowledged raising $1.7 million from Epstein for the MIT Media Lab and his own funds, and took steps to conceal the relationship.
Lloyd failed to inform MIT of multiple donations from Epstein, including a $60,000 gift deposited into a personal account.
Aidala is a member of Weinstein's legal team, filing motions regarding jury selection in his sex-crimes trial.
Klein is Griffith's attorney, stating they will vigorously contest the charges against him.

events.title: SDNY News Clips Publication
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York distributes a compilation of news clips covering various high-profile cases, including Parnas, Avenatti, Epstein, Weinstein, and Griffith.

events.title: Lev Parnas Shares Evidence with Congress
events.description: Parnas, through his attorney Joe Bondy, begins sharing files and iPhone data with the House Intelligence Committee in response to a subpoena, potentially impacting Trump's Senate impeachment trial.

events.title: Scheduled Start of Avenatti Trial
events.description: Michael Avenatti's trial for allegedly extorting Nike is scheduled to begin in Manhattan.

events.title: MIT Epstein Donation Report Released
events.description: Law firm Goodwin Procter releases a report detailing Jeffrey Epstein's $850,000 in donations to MIT from 2002 to 2017, and visits from 2013 to 2017, revealing administrative awareness and mistakes in judgment.

events.title: Weinstein Trial Jury Selection
events.description: Jury selection continues for Harvey Weinstein's sex-crimes trial in New York, marked by disputes over juror bias and media exposure.

events.title: Virgil Griffith Indicted
events.description: Ethereum developer Virgil Griffith is indicted on one count of conspiracy to violate the International Emergency Economic Powers Act for providing services to North Korea.

events.title: Griffith Released on Bail
events.description: Virgil Griffith is released on bail after satisfying bail conditions.

events.title: Scheduled Weinstein Trial Opening Statements
events.description: Opening statements in Harvey Weinstein's New York sex-crimes trial are targeted to begin.

keyFacts: Lev Parnas's iPhone 11 and other files, containing potential evidence of his close ties to Trump and Rudy Giuliani, are being delivered to Congress, which could impact Trump's Senate impeachment trial.
A report confirms Jeffrey Epstein donated $850,000 to MIT from 2002-2017, with top administrators aware of the gifts; professor Seth Lloyd was placed on leave for failing to report donations.
Michael Avenatti's defense claims newly unearthed text messages show Nike executives mocking the FBI investigation, which they argue justifies subpoenaing the executives for his extortion trial.
Harvey Weinstein's sex-crimes trial is underway with contentious jury selection; his attorney argued for private questioning due to media bias, but the judge strongly disagreed.
Ethereum developer Virgil Griffith was indicted for conspiring to violate sanctions by providing cryptocurrency services to North Korea after attending a conference there despite warnings.
